passages.text: Market Insights | Markets | Asia市场洞察 | 市场动态 | 亚洲板块

Prepared by a Goldman Sachs Global Banking & Markets Division, which may have a position in the products mentioned that is inconsistent with the views expressed in this material. In evaluating this material, you should know that it could have been previously provided to other clients and/or internal Goldman Sachs personnel, who could have already acted on it. The views or ideas expressed here are those of the desk and/or author only and are no an official view of Goldman Sachs; others at Goldman Sachs may have opinions or may express views that are contrary to those herein. This material is not independent advice and is not a product of Global Investment Research. This material is a solicitation of derivatives business generally, only for the purposes of, and to the extent it would otherwise be subject to, CFTC Regulations 1.71 and 23.605. Past performance is not an indicator of future results. Goldman Sachs provides no assurance that future results will be consistent with the projected analysis.

本材料由高盛全球银行与市场部编制，该部门可能持有与文中观点不一致的所提及产品的头寸。在评估本材料时，您应知悉其可能已提前提供给其他客户和/或高盛内部人员，且相关方可能已据此采取行动。此处表达的观点或想法仅代表交易台及/或作者个人立场，并非高盛官方观点；高盛其他人员可能持有不同意见或表达相反观点。本材料不构成独立建议，亦非全球投资研究部产品。本材料仅为依据CFTC 条例1.71和23.605 规定开展的衍生品业务招揽行为。历史表现不预示未来结果。高盛不保证未来结果将与预测分析保持一致。

The trading desk may have a position in the financial products discussed below from time to time, and holds such a position at this time. All references to "we/us/our" refer to GSK & Equities Division unless specified.
交易部门可能不时持有下文讨论的金融产品头寸，且当前正持有相关仓位。文中所有“我们/我方”的表述如无特别说明均指高盛FICC及股票部门。
- USTF- The UST curve twist steepened on Friday as front end yields fell after Fed Daly said it will soon

- USTF- The UST curve twist steepened on Friday as front end yields fell after Fed Daly said it will soon be time to recalibrate policy, whilst the long came under pressure ahead of expected heavy corporate supply this coming week. US10y closed 2.5bp cheaper at 4.228%, while the 5s30s curve steepened 4.7bp to 123.2bp. Data was mixed, with core PCE in line with expectations, UMich sentiments revised lower, and trade deficits widening. GS revised our Q3 GDP forecast down to 1.6% from 1.8%. On net, the data was friendly for the front-end and was a driver of the move. EGB and GBP curves also steepened materially today with the moves also lead by the long-end. Swap spreads were mixed, with volumes running at 20% below recent averages. 3m10y vols are still hovering at multi-year lows.
Looking ahead to next week, supply cools down and all eyes are on ISM and the August NFP print.

美国国债——上周五美债收益率曲线呈现陡峭化扭转，短端收益率因美联储官员戴利表态"政策即将需要重新校准"而走低，长端则因预期本周企业债大量发行承压。10年期美债收益率收盘上行2.5个基点至 \(4.228\%\) ，5s30s期限利差拓宽4.7个基点至123.2个基点。经济数据喜忧参半：核心PCE符合预期，密歇根大学消费者信心指数下修，贸易逆差扩大。高盛将第三季度GDP预测从 \(1.8\%\) 下调至 \(1.6\%\) 。总体而言，数据对短端有利并成为行情推手。欧元区国债和英国国债曲线今日同样显著趋陡，同样由长端引领走势。互换利差涨跌互现，成交量较近期均值低 \(20\%\) 。3个月/10年期波动率仍徘徊在多年低位。展望下周，债券发行节奏放缓，ISM数据和8月非农就业报告将成为市场焦点。

- Buns - In Europe, bonds were steeper as steepening flows bled into the complex from USTs. Buns closed 2bps cheaper, while BTPs underperformed that by 2bps. Oats/Bunds was 1bp wider. Equities across the region declined; Stoxx Europe 600 fell 0.57%, Germany's DAX lost 0.50%, France's CAC dropped 0.76%, and the Swiss Market Index was off 0.26%. Elsewhere, Portugal was upgraded to A+ from A by the S&P. And Norway picked the UK to supply frigates for its navy in a £10 billion deal, its biggest ever defense investment. Ahead, ECB Executive Board members Isabel Schnabel and Piero Cipollone chair panels, and President Christine Lagarde gives a dinner speech, at the ECB legal conference in Frankfurt.

德债——欧洲债券收益率曲线趋陡，因美债市场的陡峭化走势蔓延至欧债市场。德债收盘收益率上升2个基点，而意大利BTP债券表现更弱，收益率多涨2个基点。OATS/德债利差扩大1个基点。欧洲股市普遍下跌：斯托克欧洲600指数下跌 \(0.57\%\) ，德国DAX指数下跌 \(0.50\%\) ，法国CAC指数下跌 \(0.76\%\) ，瑞士市场指数下跌 \(0.26\%\) 。其他方面，标普将葡萄牙主权评级从A上调至A+；挪威与英国达成价值100亿英镑的护卫舰采购协议，创下该国国防投资历史新高。后续关注：欧洲央行执委施纳贝尔和奇波洛内在法兰克福举行的欧洲央行法律会议上主持专题讨论，行长拉加德将发表晚宴演讲。

- Gilts - In the UK Gilts bear steepened closing around 2.5bps weaker (5/30's 2.3bps steeper, widest since 2017) with long end yields back close to their highest since 1998. The pound pared intraday losses following a recommendation by the Institute for Public Policy Research for Chancellor Reeves to use her autumn budget to tax banks on the billions of pounds they receive in interest from the BoE on reserves held at the central bank to bolster the country's strained public finances. Shares of the biggest UK banks tumbled on Friday as a result. The DMO released the Oct-Dec 2025 issuance calendar and plans 16 Gilt auctions in Q3 including 2 syndications. Lloyds business barometer rose 2pts to 54 in August (prev. 52), highest since November 2015. This week brings the monthly PMI's and delayed July retail sales data. DMO sells new 10yr October 2035 Gilt via syndication on Tuesday (estimate £12bln), and GBP800mln 0.625% 2045 I/L Gilts on Thursday.

英国国债——英国国债收益率曲线呈现熊市陡峭化走势，收盘时整体走弱约2.5个基点（5/30年期利差扩大2.3个基点，创2017年以来最阔水平），长期收益率再度逼近1998年以来峰值。英镑收复盘中失地，此前公共政策研究所建议财政大臣里夫斯利用秋季预算案，对商业银行存放在央行的准备金从英国央行获得的数十亿英镑利息收入征税，以缓解该国紧张的公共财政状况。受此影响，英国大型银行股周五集体下挫。英国债务管理办公室公布2025年10- 12月发债计划，拟在第三季度进行16次国债拍卖（含2次银团发行）。8月劳埃德银行商业景气指数上升2点至54（前值52），创2015年11月以来新高。本周将公布月度PMI数据和延后的7月零售销售数据。债务管理办公室将于周二通过银团发行新10年期2035年10月到期国债（预估规模120亿英镑），周四发行8亿英镑0.625%票息的2045年通胀挂钩国债。

- JGBs - Tokyo CPI came in line with expectations and having little impact on the market. Ahead of the month-end big extension, participants were mostly in wait-and-see mode, but sector dynamics varied. The 15yr sector saw strong bids, while persistent offers at -1.0bps in the 20yr kept a lid on any rally despite some buying interest. The 25yr sector was marked by wide bid-offer spreads and very few trades, reflecting uncertainty around potential liquidity enhancement auction reductions. In the current 30yr, stubborn offers at -2.5bps suggested some buying interest but limited rally potential. The
off- the- run 40yr appeared heavy, with offers dominating.

日本国债——东京CPI数据符合预期，对市场影响甚微。临近月底大规模展期操作前，市场参与者多持观望态度，但各期限品种表现分化。15年期品种买盘强劲，而20年期品种在- 1.0个基点的持续卖压抑制了反弹空间，尽管存在部分买兴。25年期品种买卖价差显著扩大且成交寥寥，反映出市场对流动性增强拍卖规模可能缩减的担忧。当前30年期品种在- 2.5个基点的顽固卖盘表明虽存买兴但反弹动能有限。非活跃40年期品种则呈现抛压主导的疲软态势。

AUD- In Australia, the curve steepened over the course of Friday night trading. In line with the recent trend over the past several days, Sep and Nov RBA contracts were dominated by paying throughout the session. Ahead, the focus will be on 2Q2025 GDP. We expect GDP to increase \(0.5\% \text{qqq}\) , taking the year- ended rate to \(1.6\% \text{yo}\) . We will also receive more timely updates on household spending, housing market and trade balance.
澳元——在澳大利亚，上周五夜盘交易期间收益率曲线趋陡。延续过去几日的趋势，9月和11月澳洲联储合约整场交易中支付方占据主导。接下来市场焦点将转向2025年第二季度GDP数据。我们预计季环比增速将达 \(0.5\%\) ，使年化增长率升至 \(1.6\%\) 。此外还将获得有关家庭支出、房地产市场及贸易余额的更及时数据更新。

Equities - US equities sold off on Friday to finish in the red: SPX - 64bps to 6460, NDX - 122bps to 23,415, RTY - 50bps to 2366.6 of 11 sectors ended the day higher, with Healthcare +73bps and Consumer Staples +64bps outperforming, and Info Tech - 163bps and Consumer Discretionary - 114bps lagging. Data Centers (GSTMTDAT, - 337bps), AI Semis (GSCBSMHX, - 322bps), and AI (GSTMTAIP - 245bps) all fell, while Bitcoin Sensitives (GSCBBTC1, +304bps) posted a strong gain. DELL - 9% and MRVL - 19% fell on weak quarterly numbers, while BABA +13% gained on strong quarterly profit and news they are developing a new, more versatile chip. ULTA sold off - 7%, despite a clean beat and raise as investors fixated on compressed margin outlook. NVDA - 3.3% led a broader AI selloff, on news that DeepSeek uses Huawei chips to train some of its models.

股市——美国股市周五收跌：标普500指数下跌64个基点至6460点，纳斯达克100指数下跌122个基点至23415点，罗素2000指数下跌50个基点至2366点。11个板块中有6个当日收涨，医疗保健板块（+73个基点）和必需消费品板块（+64个基点）表现领先，而信息技术板块（- 163个基点）和非必需消费品板块（- 114个基点）表现落后。数据中心板块（GSTMTDAT，- 337个基点）、AI半导体板块（GSCBSMHX，- 322个基点）和人工智能板块（GSTMTAIP，- 245个基点）均下跌，而比特币相关板块（GSCBBTC1，+304个基点）则大幅上涨。戴尔（DELL）下跌 \(9\%\) ，迈威尔科技（MRVL）下跌 \(19\%\) ，因季度业绩疲软；而阿里巴巴（BABA）上涨 \(13\%\) ，得益于强劲的季度利润及开发新型多功能芯片的消息。Ultra Beauty（ULTA）下跌 \(7\%\) ，尽管业绩超预期且上调指引，但投资者关注其利润率前景承压。英伟达（NVDA）下跌 \(3.3\%\) ，引领人工智能板块普遍下跌，因有消息称深度求索使用华为芯片训练部分模型。

FX - The Dollar pared back earlier gains and is now trading marginally weaker than its G10 peers into the close. GBP ended the day flat after retracing 50bps worth of losses that followed the recommendation by the Institute for Public Policy Research for Finance minister Rachel Reeves to use her autumn budget to tax banks on the billions of pounds they receive in interest from the Bank of England on reserves held at the central bank (Reuters). GBPUSD lower hedges has been very topical with cross- asset clients ahead of the UK Autumn budget release, where tariff- incorporated OBR forecasts and high GILT yields (borrowing costs) may pressure fiscal headroom and require higher taxes to offset. EUR ended the day +10bps stronger, also paring back early losses that initially followed the release of softer flash Euro inflation data.

外汇市场——美元回吐早盘涨幅，收盘时兑G10货币小幅走弱。英镑日内持平，此前公共政策研究所建议财政大臣瑞秋·里维斯在秋季预算中对银行从英国央行储备金利息中获得的数十亿英镑征税（路透社），英镑随后收复了50个基点的跌幅。在英国秋季预算公布前，英镑兑美元下行对冲策略成为跨资产客户热议话题——纳入关税因素的预算责任办公室预测报告与高企的金边债券收益率（借贷成本）可能挤压财政空间，需通过增税来抵消。欧元日元上涨10个基点，同样收复了早盘因欧元区通胀初值疲软数据引发的跌幅。

1/ Global Rates Trader: Let the Data Do the Work – Despite relative stability at the very front-end of the US curve, cut pricing in 2026 has continued to build alongside a rise in risk premium at the long-end. This has resulted in a steeper curve than the fundamental picture would typically justify and has sustained the outperformance of belly breakevens. While risks surrounding the future composition of the Fed will likely persist, the busy upcoming data calendar should see the market return its focus to 2025 pricing where the market remains on the hawkish side of our economists' Fed baseline. As a result we continue to favor short expiry receivers on the front-end as a means to navigate event risk, and hold SFR25 longs cross market versus ERZ5. OAT- Bund spreads have widened in advance of a confidence vote scheduled for 8 September. We think the market is already pricing in enough premium for deficit deterioration, and that spreads will ultimately tighten unless the risks of fresh elections rise. We also see limited room for spillovers to other sovereign spread markets, or to Bunds – although we do think the risk-reward in Bund swap spread tightening is currently poor. Upcoming inflation data will be key for UK rates, we recommend 2s5s Gilt steepeners given our baseline for deeper cuts, but also for a scenario of data resilience resulting in a combination of shallow cuts and higher terminal rates.

1/ 全球利率交易员：让数据说话——尽管美国收益率曲线前端保持相对稳定，但2026年的降息预期仍在持续升温，同时长端风险溢价上升。这导致曲线陡峭程度超出基本面通常所能支撑的水平，并维持了中期盈亏平衡通胀率的优异表现。虽然美联储未来人事构成的不确定性可能持续存在，但即将密集发布的经济数据应会使市场注意力重新转向2025年利率定价——当前市场预期仍比我们经济学家对美联储的基准预测更为鹰派。因此我们继续建议通过前端短期利率互换接收方头寸来应对事件风险，并维持SFRZ5多头跨市场对冲ERZ5的策略。在9月8日信任投票前夕，法国OAT国债与德国国债利差已有所扩大。我们认为市场已对财政赤字恶化风险计入了足够溢价，除非重新选举风险上升，否则利差终将收窄。尽管我们认为当前德债互换利差收窄的风险回报比欠佳，但预计其对其他主权债利差市场或德债本身的溢出效应空间有限。即将公布的英国通胀数据将成为利率走势的关键，基于我们对更大幅度降息的基准预测，同时考虑到数据韧性可能导致“小幅降息+更高终端利率”组合的情景，我们建议做陡2年期与5年期英国国债收益率曲线。
https://marquee.gs.com/content/research/en/reports/2025/08/29/b6725bea- 3e05- 4b3b- ab74- 949b2ee25a50. html

2/ Global FX Trader: From the Fed to the Fix – We think the RMB moves last week are important, which is why it got top billing in the FX Trader despite the critical payrolls report on the docket for this week. In our view, it was notable these came without much FX market pressure—DXY has been flat for two months and both CNY and CNH were trading weak to the fix when policymakers moved it stronger still, which is an unusual combination. There are good cyclical and structural reasons for the RMB to strengthen, and it's a key ingredient to the broad Dollar as we look for new leadership in the depreciation trend. We think the forces that weighed on the Dollar in H1 are still active, and we increasingly see the required ingredients—like the CNY fix signals—for a more sustained depreciation. We see the softening labor market as confirmation of the main thrust behind our view that the Dollar should fall further; the US is not outperforming the way it has for much of the last decade, and that warrants a weaker currency. We think it would take an outsized surprise in the unemployment rate to provide a meaningful dovish impulse on USD. But over the medium term, FX investors should not conflate the “curious kind of balance” created by the simultaneous slowing in labor supply and demand with something that is necessarily good for the Dollar. We don't think the French fiscal risks now coming into focus a little earlier present much of a hurdle to this view, or will prevent the kind of rebalancing that often benefits the Scandis. But it is one marginal reason
why we still look for a little more downside in EUR/CHF, although investors should be more tactical now that things have normalized somewhat since we initiated the trade recommendation.

2/全球外汇交易员视角：从美联储到中间价——我们认为上周人民币的走势意义重大，因此尽管本周将公布关键的非农就业报告，我们仍将其作为外汇交易员栏目的头条。在我们看来，值得关注的是这些变动并未伴随显著的外汇市场压力——美元指数已横盘两月，当政策制定者推动人民币走强时，境内外人民币汇率仍弱于中间价，这种组合实属罕见。人民币走强存在良好的周期性与结构性动因，随着我们寻找贬值趋势中的新主导因素，这将成为美元全面走势的关键要素。我们认为上半年压制美元的力量仍在发挥作用，且我们越来越多地观察到持续贬值所需的要素——比如人民币中间价释放的信号。劳动力市场疲软进一步印证了我们看空美元的核心逻辑：美国经济已不复过去十年的相对优势，这理应导致货币走弱。我们认为除非失业率出现超预期波动，否则难以对美元形成实质性的鸽派刺激。但从中期来看，外汇投资者不应将劳动力供需同步放缓所创造的“微妙平衡”与必然利好美元的因素混为一谈。我们认为近期稍早浮出水面的法国财政风险不会对这一观点构成实质障碍，也不会阻碍通常利好斯堪的纳维亚货币的再平衡进程。不过这也是我们仍看跌欧元/瑞郎的边际因素之一，尽管鉴于交易建议提出后市场已有所企稳，投资者当前应采取更具战术性的操作策略。
https://marquee.gs.com/content/research/en/reports/2025/08/29/f09e4e6f- 1a0f- 4db7- 9e92- 7bd89af59685. html

OTC Derivatives Risk Disclosures:

Terms of the Transaction: To understand clearly the terms and conditions of any OTC derivative transaction you may enter into, you should carefully review the Master Agreement, including any related schedules, credit support documents, addenda and exhibits. You should not enter into OTC derivative transactions unless you understand the terms of the transaction you are entering into as well as the nature and extent of your risk exposure. You should also be satisfied that the OTC derivative transaction is appropriate for you in light of your circumstances and financial condition. You may be requested to post margin or collateral to support written OTC derivatives at levels consistent with the internal policies of Goldman Sachs.
交易条款说明：在参与任何场外衍生品交易前，您应仔细审阅主协议及其所有附件，包括相关附表、信用支持文件、补充协议及附录，以充分理解交易条款与条件。除非您已完全了解所涉及交易的具体条款及自身风险敞口的性质与程度，否则不应进行场外衍生品交易。您还需根据自身情况与财务状况，确认该等交易对您具有适当性。高盛可能要求您按照其内部政策规定的标准，为场外衍生品空头头寸提交保证金或担保品。

Liquidity Risk: There is no public market for OTC derivative transactions and, therefore, it may be difficult or impossible to liquidate an existing position on favorable terms. Transfer Restrictions: OTC derivative transactions entered into with one or more affiliates of The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. (Goldman Sachs) cannot be assigned or otherwise transferred without its prior written consent and, therefore, it may be impossible for you to transfer any OTC derivative transaction to a third party.
流动性风险：场外衍生品交易不存在公开市场，因此可能难以或无法以有利条件平仓现有头寸。转让限制：与高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）一家或多家关联方达成的场外衍生品交易，未经其事先书面同意不得转让，因此您可能无法将任何场外衍生品交易转让给第三方。

Conflict of Interests: Goldman Sachs may from time to time be an active participant on both sides of the market for the underlying securities, commodities, futures, options or any other derivative or instrument identical or related to those mentioned herein (together, "the Product"). Goldman Sachs at any time may have long or short positions in, or buy and sell Products (on a principal basis or otherwise) identical or related to those mentioned herein. Goldman Sachs hedging and
trading activities may affect the value of the Products.
利益冲突：高盛可能不时在标的证券、商品、期货、期权或任何其他与本交所或证券产品相同或相关的衍生品或工具（统称“产品”）市场中的时担任买卖双方活跃参与者。高盛可能在任何时间持有与本文所证券产品相同或相关产品的多头或空头头寸，或进行买卖（以自营或其他方式）。高盛的对冲和交易活动可能影响产品价值。

Counterparty Credit Risk: Because Goldman Sachs, may be obligated to make substantial payments to you as a condition of an OTC derivative transaction, you must evaluate the credit risk of doing business with Goldman Sachs or its affiliates.
交易对手信用风险：由于高盛可能因场外衍生品交易条款而需向贵方支付大额款项，贵方必须评估与高盛或其关联公司开展业务所涉及的信用风险。

Pricing and Valuation: The price of each OTC derivative transaction is individually negotiated between Goldman Sachs and each counterparty and Goldman Sachs does not represent or warrant that the prices for which it offers OTC derivative transactions are the best prices available, possibly making it difficult for you to establish what is a fair price for a particular OTC derivative transaction; The value or quoted price of the Product at any time, however, will reflect many factors and cannot be predicted. If Goldman Sachs makes a market in the offered Product, the price quoted by Goldman Sachs would reflect any changes in market conditions and other relevant factors, and the quoted price (and the value of the Product that Goldman Sachs will use for account statements or otherwise) could be higher or lower than the original price, and may be higher or lower than the value of the Product as determined by reference to pricing models used by Goldman Sachs. If at any time a third party dealer quotes a price to purchase the Product or otherwise values the Product, that price may be significantly different (higher or lower) than any price quoted by Goldman Sachs. Furthermore, if you sell the Product, you will likely be charged a commission for secondary market transactions, or the price will likely reflect a dealer discount. Goldman Sachs may conduct market making activities in the Product. To the extent Goldman Sachs makes a market, any price quoted for the OTC derivative transactions, Goldman Sachs may differ significantly from (i) their value determined by reference to Goldman Sachs pricing models and (ii) any price quoted by a third party. The market price of the OTC derivative transaction may be influenced by many unpredictable factors, including economic conditions, the creditworthiness of Goldman Sachs, the value of any underlyers, and certain actions taken by Goldman Sachs.

定价与估值：每笔场外衍生品交易的价格均由高盛与各交易对手方单独协商确定，高盛并不承诺其报价为市场最优价格，因此您可能难以判断特定场外衍生品交易的公允价格；产品在任何时点的价值或报价将受多重因素影响且无法预判。若高盛就该产品做市，其报价将反映市场环境及其他相关因素的变化，所报价格（及高盛用于账户报表或其他用途的产品估值）可能高于或低于初始价格，且与高盛定价模型测算的产品价值存在偏差。若第三方交易商在任何时点提供产品买入报价或估值，该价格可能与高盛报价存在显著差异（更高或更低）。此外，若您出售该产品，很可能会被收取二级市场交易佣金，或价格将反映交易商折扣。高盛可能对该产品开展做市活动。在高盛担任做市商的情况下，场外衍生品交易的任何报价可能与以下两项存在显著差异：(i)根据高盛定价模型确定的价值；(ii)第三方提供的任何报价。场外衍生品交易的市场价格可能受诸多不可预测因素影响，包括经济状况、高盛信用资质、任何标的资产价值以及高盛采取的特定行动。

Market Making, Investing and Lending: Goldman Sachs engages in market making, investing and lending businesses for its own account and the accounts of its affiliates in the same or similar instruments underlying OTC derivative transactions (including such trading as Goldman Sachs deems appropriate in its sole discretion to hedge its market risk in any OTC derivative transaction whether between Goldman Sachs and you or with third parties) and such trading may affect the value of an OTC derivative transaction.
做市、投资与借贷业务：高盛集团为其自身及关联方账户开展与场外衍生品交易基础工具相同或相似的做市、投资及借贷业务（包括高盛单方面认为适当的对冲其场外衍生品交易市场风险的操作，无论该交易发生在高盛与您之间或与第三方之间），此类交易可能影响场外衍生品交易的价值。

Early Termination Payments: The provisions of an OTC Derivative Transaction may allow for early termination and, in such cases, either you or Goldman Sachs may be required to make a potentially significant termination payment depending upon whether the OTC Derivative Transaction is in- the- money to Goldman Sachs or you at the time of termination. Indexes: Goldman Sachs does not warrant, and takes no responsibility for, the structure, method of computation or publication of any currency exchange rates, interest rates, indexes of such rates, or credit, equity or other indexes, unless Goldman Sachs specifically advises you otherwise.
提前终止付款：场外衍生品交易条款可能允许提前终止，在此情况下，根据终止时交易对高盛或您是否处于价内状态，任何一方都可能需要支付金额可能重大的终止款项。指数责任：除非高盛特别告知，高盛不对任何汇率、利率、相关利率指数或信用、股票及其他指数的结构、计算方法或发布方式作出保证或承担责任。

Terms of the Transaction: To understand clearly the terms and conditions of any OTC derivative transaction you may enter into, you should carefully review the MasterAgreement, including any related schedules, credit support documents, addenda and exhibits. You should not enter into OTC derivative transactions unless you understand the terms of the transaction you are entering into as well as the nature and extent of your risk exposure. You should also be satisfied that the OTC derivative transaction is appropriate for you in light of your circumstances and financial condition. You may be requested to post margin or collateral to support written OTC derivatives at levels consistent with the internal policies of Goldman Sachs.

Liquidity Risk: There is no public market for OTC derivative transactions and, therefore, it may be difficult or impossible to liquidate an existing position on favorable terms. Transfer Restrictions: OTC derivative transactions entered into with one or more affiliates of The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. (Goldman Sachs) cannot be assigned or otherwise transferred without its prior written consent and, therefore, it may be impossible for you to transfer any OTC derivative transaction to a third party.

Conflict of Interests: Goldman Sachs may from time to time be an active participant on both sides of the market for the underlying securities, commodities, futures, options or any other derivative or instrument identical or related to those mentioned herein (together, "the Product"). Goldman Sachs at any time may have long or short positions in, or buy and sell Products (on a principal basis or otherwise) identical or related to those mentioned herein. Goldman Sachs hedging and trading activities may affect the value of the Products.

Counterparty Credit Risk: Because Goldman Sachs, may be obligated to make substantial payments to you as a condition of an OTC derivative transaction, you must evaluate the credit risk of doing business with Goldman Sachs or its affiliates.

Pricing and Valuation: The price of each OTC derivative transaction is individually negotiated between Goldman Sachs and each counterparty and Goldman Sachs does not represent or warrant that the prices for which it offers OTC derivative transactions are the best prices available, possibly making it difficult for you to establish what is a fair price for a particular OTC derivative transaction; The value or quoted price of the Product at any time, however, will reflect many factors and cannot be predicted. If Goldman Sachs makes a market in the offered Product, the price quoted by Goldman Sachs would reflect any changes in market conditions and other relevant factors, and the quoted price (and the value of the Product that Goldman Sachs will use for account statements or otherwise) could be higher or lower than the original price, and may be higher or lower than the value of the Product as determined by reference to pricing models used by Goldman Sachs. If at any time a third party dealer quotes a price to purchase the Product or otherwise values the Product, that price may be significantly different (higher or lower) than any price quoted by Goldman Sachs. Furthermore, if you sell the Product, you will likely be charged a commission for secondary market transactions, or the price will likely reflect a dealer discount. Goldman Sachs may conduct market making activities in the Product. To the extent Goldman Sachs makes a market, any price quoted for the OTC derivative transactions, Goldman Sachs may differ significantly from (i) their value determined by reference to Goldman Sachs pricing models and (ii) any price quoted by a third party. The market price of the OTC derivative transaction may be influenced by many unpredictable factors, including economic conditions, the creditworthiness of Goldman Sachs, the value of any underlyers, and certain actions taken by Goldman Sachs.

Market Making, Investing and Lending: Goldman Sachs engages in market making, investing and lending businesses for its own account and the accounts of its affiliates in the same or similar instruments underlying OTC derivative transactions (including such trading as Goldman Sachs deems appropriate in its sole discretion to hedge its market risk in any OTC derivative transaction whether between Goldman Sachs and you or with third parties) and such trading may affect the value of an OTC derivative transaction.

Early Termination Payments: The provisions of an OTC Derivative Transaction may allow for early termination and, in such cases, either you or Goldman Sachs may be required to make a potentially significant termination payment depending upon whether the OTC Derivative Transaction is in- the- money to Goldman Sachs or you at the time of termination. Indexes: Goldman Sachs does not warrant, and takes no responsibility for, the structure, method of computation or publication of any currency exchange rates, interest rates, indexes of such rates, or credit, equity or other indexes, unless Goldman Sachs specifically advises you otherwise.
